bow: have never been pregnant but hope to be in the future my question is that as get older and think about pregnancy and amp lean more towards not having an epidural or maybe having water bath two of my good friends just had babies within the last months and they like to tell stories about their experience and we all enjoy listening to them lot of times we talk about friends of friends and their experiences too have heard from few women that through pregnancy and even up to the first stages of labor they did not want an epidural but the contractions were too much and got the epidural was just wondering if it pain tolerance thing or an easy temptation etc have any of you went in not wanting an epidural but ended up getting one anyway and why did you change your mind just curious thanks did not want an epidural with my first went into labor friday night saturday morning at am and had my baby saturday night sunday morning at am so just shy of 24 hours was so tired my back labor was so intense and the contractions were constant just could not get it had my epidural about 10pm was different person after that was able to enjoy my labor and relax with my second wanted it from the get go was induced at got epidural at my blood pressure dropped and passed out they continued the epidural slowly to make sure was okay sadly the epidural failed it numbed my left side but not my right made the pain feel worse but honestly think was so excited about the epidural that it was the disappointment that it failed that made things worse had my daughter at and the epidural finally took total effect at which was miserable because they would let me leave the bed then all can say is go in open minded do shut your mind off from getting the epidural but also do put all your faith in it working ended up with an epidural with my first after nearly 18 hours of hard labor of which was in tub got it because they started talking about section due to baby being twisted in the birth canal and heart rates dropping was fortunate enough to not need cs while had gone into my first labor very firmly believing in no drugs or intervention my second not having my mind made up either way had very hard and intense labor with my second and opted for an epi few hours in knew what both ways were like and felt like be able to rest more for the pushing stage with an epi as for the pain yeah it hurts it hurts lot but no one understands your body like you do and no one knows your limits like you and if anyone ever gives you crap for getting an epidural screw them it all about personalized birth for yourself there no shame either way oh my gosh that so awful thanks for sharing whenever that day comes will go into it open minded hmmm okay thanks how you like the tub my boyfriend wife had water birth she lives across the country so have met her yet so ca get her opinion of it just yet but from what ve heard she enjoyed it with my first went in to labour it was fast and hard did change my mind for an epidural but still feel that was pushed into it by the staff my first was fast and intense no one was listening to me was unable to be assertive as was focusing on the contractions the doctor rolled her eyes at me they refused to get me water and had to go into the bathroom and drink from the tap they had me sign for an epidurial after it was placed had already called the anistheologist even though said no when he got there felt had to have it done since he was there and they were all making huge deal about it he also gave me some sort of shot in my iv to get me to sit still had my daughter an hour and half later she was also very sleepy baby the first few days and was very sore the first weeks second baby was also intense had midwife but was transferred to an obgyn to have an induction due to iugr demanded different hospital this time chose the form of induction cervadil tab when they wanted pitocin and prostaglandin gel chose to not have an iv was informed every step of the way even though it was not my original plan it went quick and was quite painful but her placenta was detaching and that is painful on its own on top of the contractions but we got through it still did not need an iv or pain meds second daughter was alert afterwards ate well and felt great after days seriously everyone kept telling me to take it easy it felt like just deep work out they kept trying to give me prescription for t3 and kept telling me did not have to be brave for the pain afterwards had only requested an ibuprofen the next day due to headache that was all it was crazy refused the prescription but they snuck it in my bag with al the info packets from the hospital they did not believe that was feeling fine felt no after pains or cramps and just little sore its interesting cause my cousin also had an epi with her first went with midwife for hee second cause it was cheaper she had moved from canada to the us she fully expected to get pain meds ended up happening so quickly she did it naturally at home she also felt great very soon afterwards with her natutal birth with her first it took weeks before she could sit without some padding tub was awesome did you mean to write your bf wife little dumbfounded on that one was the opposite went in planning to have an epidural and then remembered that am terrified of needles and went natural am so sorry about your first hospital that is shitty experience did it help with the pain at all lol no absolutely did not mean that my boyfriend brother wife oops ha yeah think that may happen to me not terrified of needles but may be when they come headed towards my spine will be how long was your labor or how long were you in serious pain for my first baby was 8weeks early and do remember if asked for the epidural or if someone suggested it but got it they had to induce me because got bladder infection so my water broke on saturday morning at about the 32wk mark and since was low on amniotic fluid they induced that monday my epidural worked perfectly there was no pain and pushing was simple except they kept asking me to move my legs of course could so kept giggling at them when my daughter finally did come out it just felt kind like big poop felt her come out but what did feel was the episiotomy they gave me in case they had to use the forceps with my son was all for having another epidural because giving birth hurts at least that what everyone told me with him was in labor 20 min after my water broke and he was here there was never any time to get me checked into amp much less get an epidural say do research talk to people talk to your ob gyn and make your own choice do feel like you are forced to either side of it because you ll hate it forever good luck with getting pregnant pregnancy and all that comes with it that awesome and agree with the other lady sorry for your first shitty experience have been through birth or anything yet so ca actually answer your question but think my general plan is that need to be open minded but also prepared will learn some sort of pain management techniques like hypno babies or bradley method or something because know that if just walk into labor without any pain management techniques will be shocked at the pain and probably just get an epidural also want to give birth in birthing center as opposed to traditional hospital amp because you do really have access to an epidural in birthing center birthing centers attached to hospital are nice in my opinion because it is super close to the hospital just in case you need transfer every labor and woman is different too sometimes babies are facing the right way and it makes it way more painful sometimes they get stuck sometimes the mom gets back labor some women have higher pain tolerances than others sometimes labor lasts for so long that you just need way to rest so that you will have the strength to push when the time comes there are so many different factors which is why its so important to be open minded and not judge your mom worthiness on whether or not your labor is epidural free or not thanks for sharing great stories thanks not sure when it will happen but everybody around me is popping babies out left and right so of course it crosses my mind when the time is right it ll happen agreed and absolutely when it time will definitely look into the pain management techniques birthing centers etc thanks went in not wanting any intervention but learned that the doc who was working that night was the same one that admitted me he was very pushy wanted the midwife to deliver my baby so in the end it became time crunch that required pitocin the pitocin contractions were 5x worse than those without so caved for an epidural on the plus side my baby was delivered hrs after the pitocin was started and by the midwife oh that great ve heard mothers claim that pitocin makes the contractions worse is that true or do they just get more intense as they get closer together yeah it was lame sauce but it helped me get very well informed and asserted myself with the second it was great to be heard and felt like we worked together vs the hospital staff telling me how it would be if it helps my first labor was hrs and my second was hrs and 16 mins swear red raspberry leaf tea played role in the short labours my cousin was hrs for her first and 5hrs with her second had convinced her to try the red raspberry leaf tea her last couple weeks with her first she also drank it with her second haha really when are you supposed to drink it have delivered yet but think it depends on the situation the oldest of four and my mom went in wanting an all natural birth no drugs the further along she got in labor the more she wanted the epidural but they told her it was too late she had to just push was born fairly quickly though was the longest labor of all of us kids my baby sister was born just over year later and mom did even make it out of the driveway in the ambulance before my sister was born so no epidural that time either my oldest brother was born years ago this january our hospital was 40 minutes away and he was born the night of blizzard so it took us some time to get there by then she was pretty well into labor and she did get an epidural with him either my youngest brother was born via induction almost years ago and honestly have no idea if mom had an epidural with him if she did he was the only one she did have water births with any of us but she did it all natural 75 of the time on top of the situation would say it is possible that part of it is pain tolerance lost pregnancy two years ago at weeks and the contractions had to pass everything at home were so painful that wished could have any sort of pain medication would go by me as had storybook labor and delivery had contractions during the day so made meatloaf and lasagna for my freezer shaved my legs painted my toes picked up some things at the store and cleaned then my husband dragged me to the hospital and my hospital labor part was about hours the pushing was intense like hours and do remember some painful times but ca really remember how long because my sense of time was shot ha that awesome wow that awesome pregnancy the amp all of it is so wild to think about thanks for sharing and sorry for your loss two years ago and good luck with this one thank you so much it is so crazy there so many things that happen that you do even realize without being close to it was old enough with my brothers that was able to experience lot of things with my mom actually was in the delivery room for my oldest brother birth and watched the after birth and clean up its an amazing time and an amazing journey good luck to you would want to help me and that not what happened labored for hours without anything and got to 7cm before the epi it took me hrs to dilate 3cm and pushed for 30 minutes for my second birth found friend who had natural birth and was interested in helping me with this birth accepted that my husband was going to ever be an efficient partner for me so she and talked about everything when my water broke she met us at the hospital she helped rub and push on my belly very weird ve never met anyone who wanted their baby pushed on while in labor sat next to me while was in the tub and held my had when pushed when tried to squat and ended up sobbing that wanted drugs she helped me up and comforted me that could have them if held out just few more minutes 20 minutes later had baby lol it was million times easier to deal with the nurse and doctor with her by my side from the time got to the hospital to baby being born it was only hours my third baby had at birth center with the same friend again when found out was dilating after 12 hours of my water breaking she helped me lunge up and down the halls and bounce on birth ball when was stuck in the bathroom dealing with side effects of hair after the baby was born and named after her lt she held her skin to skin while my husband helped me in the bathroom so what saying is you need good partner whether that your boyfriend husband or is also important to note had bell palsy too it did work hours later we did another it worked for few hours got little rest until it stopped my daughter was then just not progressing we started pitocin and an internal monitor ouch pitocin prior to it my contractions were adequate just not productive we did an emergency section at 17 hours my spinal went too far north due to the prior two epidurals this caused me to feel like could berate and panicked feeling like might die baby was born and whisked away very sick if we have another child will have scheduled section at 39 weeks was induced on the 19th and did have my daughter until the 21st was not happy camper wanted natural labor and the contractions were just so bad that could deal with it after 24 hours asked for something to just take the edge of the pain off it made me hallucinate once it wore off asked for my epidural and received it it only worked on which ever side of my body was tilted down since could lay flat on my back would lay on one side until the pain on the other side was unbearable and then switch sides and both sides would be ok for little while it still took forever for me to have her but could finally relax and catch little sleep with my son got the epidural the second that the dr said pitocin she had to stop it though because she thought that was too numb to push him out turns out his cord was wrapped around his neck and it was really really hard to deliver him with my youngest daughter it was planned induction very small hospital and we needed to schedule the or for my tubal the moment felt the first contraction even though it was mild got the epidural that was my easiest labor ever about hours start to finish and slept while my husband watched star trek when it was time to deliver the tv was still on and my ob kept on getting distracted and watching tv after about minutes she said enough turn it off it time to have baby we all had good laugh then they paused the screen for the contraction monitor thingy and were wondering why was having any contractions and we all laughed when we figured it out the moral of my story is had an epidural with each labor and each was different with my first it was horrible with my second it was ok until the end and with the third it was fantastic was awake and alert after birth able to care for my baby and not in pain and enjoyed getting to get to know my nurses was doing so well that the nurses even let me help give sam her first bath they told me we have never had mom like you before you are giving us anything to do with the baby you feed her you change her diaper and you wo even let us give her bath in very loving and gentle manner mine did did not feel my contractions before pitocin was on the fence about whether or not wanted an epidural worked on breathing exercises for pain relief and relaxation then went into labor during hay fever season the breathing exercises did help when could get my nose and throat clear think if did have access to the epidural would have gone without and worked harder to keep my nose clear that said glad had access to it instead of being something just endured labor was something that can remember fondly at one point shortly before my baby was born my doctor said reach down and you can feel the top of your baby head if had had the epidural there no way would ve been able to do that some women drink it all through their pregnancies always waited till 36 weeks along and drank some in the morning and evening it uterine tonic and should not cause contractions but tone it and help it work efficiently it is also good to drink during menstruation and lochia after the birth went in thinking get one at some point officially in active labor at 9am after having contractions for 24 hours stuck with it until 8pm before getting an epidural my body had been stuck at 5cms for hours at that point and it looked like section was likely had the shakes and my entire body was telling me to push but they would let me as there was still lip they could feel and baby was quite in position they let me get an epidural and rest for an hour then checked again and was at 10 finally then pushed for hours baby head was turned slightly so it was easy another hour and would have gotten the section fully believe the epidural saved me from section this time did not want an epidural but keep in mind that some labors are more painful than others depending on baby position and body shape and too much pain can stall labor speak from experience as nurse my advice is to try it without see how it goes but if you get exhausted or stalled then by all means consider it reached the point where was exhausted and was worried about having the energy to push once got to that point so opted for the epidural at 7cms which is decent portion on the way through labor it allowed me to sleep and have the energy to push when the time came also saw some beautiful births that were all natural so know it possible without an epidural for sure will go in with the same game plan for any other babies we might have ll take it if need it was open to it accidentally laboured at home entirely when got to the hospital it was push time pushed for hours but my pelvic floor muscles are so strong that was keeping her in so had to get the epidural to relax those muscles it was kind of heavenly to have the pain switched off and it gave me the strength to get through the rest of delivery had great doctor no pain but could wiggle my toes suggest just keeping an open mind maybe you can endure the pain maybe not if you do lay down any rules you wo disappoint yourself ca say from personal experience because ve only had pitocin contractions however others have told me that pitocin makes contractions much worse do know pains go from ughhh to gaaa it ups not only the intensity but the frequency sometimes would have more than seconds between contractions the water bath really helps if you re going natural but it slows 18 or so with petocin begged for an epidural the worst part of that is the needle it the fact that your legs basically do exist it really tough to turn or move at all and the numbness is spotty over time they let me extend my labor beyond the 24 hours after my water broke by hours or so could feel her pressing against my pelvis like sitting on bicycle seat sideways but eventually we decided on section dammit remember how said that the epidural was spotty it numbed my skin but not my insides felt the secion as if were being eviscerated honestly thought all the amp stories was told were more scary than what labor actually was dd was op 17hrs of back labor ended up vacuum extraction 7lbs 14oz dd was born her hand at her forehead and had shoulder dystocia got stuck on my pelvis 2hrs labor 9lbs 3oz dd was easy textbook amp 5hrs labor 9lbs each was hard easy in their own way the hard part for me was at the end when the ctx were right on top of each other just before pushing got panicky but could always just breathe through them big breath in slow out didnt get an epidural any of them think was more scared of having the epidural pitocin section cascade every woman is different though as long as you and the baby make it through healthy it doesnt matter when you re not dilated fully your body is ready found this online the danger with pushing too early is that the cervix becomes edematous and thicker thus impeding progress rather than facilitating it another thing saw was that the baby is always in position part of what makes the dilation happen is the baby moving into position with mine she was slightly turned and they kept feeling lip somehow the epidural allowed me to relax and for baby to move the rest of the way into position so was able to push at that point pitocin is bad news sorry you went through that ohh okay thanks for the information guess when that day comes we will see what my options are and go from there thanks again good luck sure you ll be fine thanks do think pitocin helped as someone else said you know your body and just when you think it getting intense but you can handle it it ramps up then you get used to that pitocin just makes it more uncomfortable in my opinion also the dripline ties you down so you ca walk so it can slow labor if you want to get an epidural it was heaven for the first half hour you have to hold still in as close to laying down position as you can so the epidural can spread evenly if you sit up which aids labor it pools in your legs rather than working on your belly back ve heard it said that epidurals make your cervix relax so it can open but it did help me just slowed my labor we re done with one awesome child if did it again probably skip the midwife appointment and walk around the birthing center hospital until my kid was on her way out ooo and protip bring clif shot bloks or sport beans energy bites are awesome for keeping you going through labor what else it than marathon you can chew them between contractions along with sips of water did want it but ended up with one after quite long time in labor with no progress stuck at cm for at least eight hours after starting labor the day before they talked me into having my waters broken manually in attempt to get things moving that started chain of events that led to baby going into distress and having decels with every contraction ended up with the epidural because they were extremely worried and wanted to prep me for section weird twist was that the epidural let me relax lot and my non progress turned into ready to push very quickly it was mostly worn off at the end and with bit of assistance he was crooked managed without section think if you re really against it watch out for the other stuff that can cause problems pitocin breaking the water etc the pain was horrific but was handling it after the water breaking was no longer allowed to move and think he might have stayed in better position if it had been done too either way he here and he magic ultimately that what matters had no epidurals but had short textbook labours the contractions were fairly fierce but not until the end if had long miserable labours would have taken the epidural for sure there is no right answer chose to go without because by the time wanted drugs it was too late anyways and had very short pushing time 15 mins 10 mins mins and quick recoveries got to shower and walk around within about 40 minutes of my births each time consider the laughing gas if you do want to go with the epi but do want some pain relief ve had friends
